javax.microedition.midlet

Class MIDlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.microedition.midlet.MIDlet
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    XConnection

    public abstract class MIDlet
extends java.lang.Object
    The MIDlet class is an abstract class that provides methods to manage the lifecycle of a MIDlet application. It includes methods to start, pause, and destroy the application, as well as to notify the system of changes in the application's state.

    • Method Detail

      • destroyApp

        public abstract void destroyApp(boolean z)
                         throws MIDletStateChangeException
        Destroys the MIDlet application.
        Parameters:
        z - a boolean indicating whether the application should be destroyed.
        Throws:
        MIDletStateChangeException - if there is an error during the destruction process.

      • pauseApp

        protected abstract void pauseApp()
        Pauses the MIDlet application.

      • startApp

        protected abstract void startApp()
                          throws MIDletStateChangeException
        Starts the MIDlet application.
        Throws:
        MIDletStateChangeException - if there is an error during the start process.

      • notifyDestroyed

        public final void notifyDestroyed()
        Notifies the system that the MIDlet has been destroyed.

      • notifyPaused

        public final void notifyPaused()
        Notifies the system that the MIDlet has been paused.

      • getAppProperty

        public final java.lang.String getAppProperty(java.lang.String key)
        Retrieves a property of the MIDlet application.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the value of the property, or null if the property is not found.

      • platformRequest

        public final boolean platformRequest(java.lang.String URL)
                              throws ConnectionNotFoundException
        Requests a platform-specific action based on the given URL.
        Parameters:
        URL - the URL specifying the action to be performed.
        Returns:
        true if the request was successful, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        ConnectionNotFoundException - if the URL is not supported or the action cannot be performed.

      • resumeRequest

        public void resumeRequest()
        Requests that the MIDlet be resumed.
